{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2014}} {{Use British English|date=February 2014}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''Big Brother 9'' housemates (UK)}} The following is a list of housemates from the [[Big Brother 9 (UK)|ninth series of ''Big Brother UK'']].
== Housemates ==
=== Alexandra === Alexandra Justine "Alex" De-Gale (born 4 August 1984) is an accounts clerk<ref>{{cite web|url=http://metro.co.uk/2008/06/10/nasty-alex-blasted-by-big-brother-182287/|title=Nasty Alex blasted by Big Brother|author=imagemetrowebukmetro|date=10 June 2008|website=Metro.co.uk}}</ref> from [[Croydon]], [[South London]]. Alexandra is a single mother who became pregnant when she was 15 years old; she has a daughter. She was raised as a [[Christianity|Christian]] but converted to [[Islam]]. Alexandra describes herself as quirky, outgoing and a go-getter, and hates to be bored.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bigbrother/displaycontestant.php?contestant_id=25|title=Profile: Alexandra|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=2008-06-08}}</ref> In an interview that aired during the launch show, she told Big Brother that "I am not an [[It girl]], I am 'it'." At Mario and Stephanie's "wedding" in week one, Alexandra was the only housemate to object, having correctly identified the marriage as a sham. She created a large amount of controversy owing to her aggressive nature and was accused of bullying.<ref>[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=884&position=11 ''Channel 4 official site''] Retrieved 2008-06-08</ref> She very quickly became the least popular housemate among viewers and during the first eviction night many of the crowd were chanting "Get Alex out!" despite not even being up for the public vote. She was ejected on day 14, not as a result of a public vote but because of the producers and Channel 4 deciding her behaviour had been unacceptable.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=2724|title=Big Brother|work=Channel 4}}</ref> After being nominated, she apparently threatened fellow housemates, saying: "I'm not throwing water at anyone. It's bigger than that... personal offence is never forgotten, do you know what I mean? We are just inside the house. I've got a very, very, very, very, very strong team outside the house. I just can't wait to see my mans and them and see what their plans are, who they got... I'm not talking about those mans, I'm talking about my gangster friends. They got some instructions to follow out."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/7462662.stm|title=BBC NEWS - Entertainment - Alexandra thrown off Big Brother|publisher=}}</ref> Neither she nor Dennis were allowed to appear on the final night with the rest of the housemates. As of 2013, Alexandra is pursuing a [[Bachelor of Laws|LLB (Hons)]] Degree at the [[University of Greenwich]].
===Belinda=== Belinda Harris-Reid (born 7 April 1964)<ref name="Smeggys BB Housemates Belinda">{{cite news|title=Smeggy's Big Brother 9 Housemates - Belinda|url=http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=be9|publisher=Smeggys.co.uk|date=2008-07-05|accessdate=2008-07-05|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081005022349/http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=be9|archivedate=5 October 2008|df=dmy-all}}</ref> is a [[theatre director]] from [[Exeter]], [[Devon]]. Belinda is married with two sons. She was born in [[Kampala]], [[Uganda]] but moved to [[Malawi]] before she was one year old, where her father founded the Chancellor College, [[University of Malawi]].<ref name="Smeggys BB Housemates Belinda" /> She lived in East Africa until the age of 11. Belinda loves jazz singing and being by the sea.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=632|title=Big Brother|work=Channel 4}}</ref> Belinda was the fifth housemate to be evicted on Day 44 with 65% of the public vote, after just two weeks of being in the house. During Belinda's eviction, filming took place for the E4 horror series [[Dead Set (TV series)|Dead Set]].
===Dale=== Dale Howard (born 30 October 1986) is a student from [[St Helens, Merseyside]].<ref name="dale">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=234 Dale] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-05</ref> Although he is a physical education trainee teacher at [[Liverpool John Moores University]], Dale says that he would rather play [[association football|football]] and has unsuccessfully tried out for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]]. He says he wouldn't dream of being a PE teacher, and that he hates kids.<ref name="ds dale">[http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bigbrother/displaycontestant.php?contestant_id=31 Dale] ''Digital Spy'' Retrieved 2008-06-05</ref> He is described by his friends and family as mostly arrogant, bigheaded and overconfident.<ref name="Dale's profile">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=234 Dale's Profile] ''Channel 4 Official Site'' Retrieved 2008-06-20</ref> In his audition Dale bragged, "If there's any [[vagina|fanny]] in there, I'm gonna nail it. Especially if they're fit!"<ref name="Why Big Brother represents a return">[http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/entertainment_news/article4085820.ece Why Big Brother represents a return] ''Times Online'' Retrieved 2008-06-08</ref> On Sunday 20 July, he succeeded Darnell as the second Head of House after his success in a task that took place to compete for the title. Dale became the eighth housemate to be evicted on Day 65 with 63% of the vote.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=13361&position=36|title= Dale is evicted|date=8 August 2008|accessdate=2008-08-08 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080822091952/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=13361&position=36 <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2008-08-22}}</ref> Dale is now producing deep house music & DJ-ing internationally and is associated with other DJ's such as 40four.
===Darnell=== Darnell Earl Swallow (born 23 September 1981) is a rapper with [[albinism]]. He was born in [[Ipswich]], [[Suffolk]], but grew up in [[St. Louis, Missouri]], United States. He was elected as the first Head of House on Day 39. Darnell finished the series in fifth place with 14.9% of the public vote.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15827&housemateId=236&position=326 |title=Darnell Is Evicted |publisher=Channel4.com |date=5 September 2008 |accessdate=2008-09-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080909213923/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15827 |archivedate=9 September 2008 }}</ref> Darnell has made his way back into the papers by appearing in a hardcore pornography series called ''What Billi Did Next'' alongside former housemates [[Billi Bhatti]], [[Rebecca Shiner]] and [[Samanda]].<ref name=Orange>{{cite web|url=http://www.orange.co.uk/entertainment/television/4930.htm|title=Entertainment add-ons|work=EE}}</ref> According to the film's makers [[Red Hot TV (UK)]] Darnell gets "his end away with an 18 year old stripper".<ref name=RedHotTV>[http://www.redhothard.com/2010/06/nude-shower-big-brother/ "Forget Nude Showering Big Brother Contestants"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100904055444/http://www.redhothard.com/2010/06/nude-shower-big-brother/ |date= 4 September 2010 }}</ref>
===Dennis=== Dennis McHugh (born 1984) is a dance teacher from [[Edinburgh]].<ref name="dennis">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=256 Dennis] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-05</ref> Dennis says if he could make any law, it would be that everyone must wear [[sunless tanning|fake tan]], and his dream job is to be a dancer and then perhaps a personal shopper. He is obsessed with dancing and describes himself as an "extreme character". In a pre-launch show interview with Big Brother, he said "If someone called me fat, I'd manipulate the little weirdo until they thought they were fat." He would most like to invite Hitler, Mother Theresa and Judy Garland to a dinner party and says that he would never go out with anyone better looking than him. On Day 23, Dennis was ejected from the Big Brother House for spitting in Mohamed's face during a row.<ref name="Dennis Removed">[http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/B/bb9/news/newsstory.jsp?id=4221 ''Channel 4 Official Site''] Retrieved 2009-02-20</ref> Neither he nor Alexandra were allowed to appear on the final night with the rest of the housemates.
===Jennifer=== Jennifer 'Jen' Clark (born 19 March 1986) is a model from [[Chester-le-Street]], [[County Durham]].<ref name="jennifer">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=260 Jennifer] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-05</ref> She says being the mother of her 22-month-old daughter Maddy has made her the proudest person in the world and has conservative views on abortion, meat-eating, smoking, immigration, gay marriage and naked glamour modelling. Although she feels really old Jennifer says she is opinionated, ruthless and ambitious and claims that she wouldn't enter Big Brother if she didn't think she could win.<ref name="Smeggys BB Housemates Jennifer">{{cite news|title=Smeggy's Big Brother 9 Housemates - Jennifer|url=http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=ljn9|publisher=Smeggys.co.uk|date=2008-06-29|accessdate=2008-06-29|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081005022354/http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=ljn9|archivedate=5 October 2008|df=dmy-all}}</ref> She was raised a Catholic and states that she hates people who spit.<ref name="ds jennifer">[http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bigbrother/displaycontestant.php?contestant_id=26 ''DigitalSpy''] Retrieved 2008-06-10</ref>
Since Big Brother, Jennifer has had numerous magazine interviews, including Heat in which she admitted her feelings for Dale.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.heatworld.com/Article/6426/Jennifer+/How+does+Jen+REALLY+feel+about+Dale|title= How does Jen REALLY feel about Dale?|publisher= Heatworld.com|date= 14 July 2008|accessdate= 2008-09-08}}</ref> Despite her earlier assertions, she has appeared topless for Nuts magazine.
===Kathreya=== Kathreya 'Kat' Kasisopa (born 1977) is a [[Thai massage]] therapist from [[Thailand]] but now lives in [[Welling]], South East [[London]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kentonline.co.uk/kol08/article/default.asp?article_id=42873 |title=Latest Big Brother contestant loves a bit of a cookie |publisher=Kent Online |date=9 June 2008 |accessdate=2008-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090728074452/http://www.kentonline.co.uk/kol08/article/default.asp?article_id=42873 |archivedate=28 July 2009 }}</ref> She relocated from [[Bangkok]] to the United Kingdom in 2001 and she has an obsession with [[cookie]]s. Kathreya says she’s addicted to them and she carries a cookie jar with her wherever she goes. Kathreya is a [[Buddhism|Buddhist]], believes strongly in karma, and will do anything to avoid an argument. She loves wearing bright clothing, and wears platform boots at all times to give her extra height as she is only {{convert|5|ft|m|abbr=on}} tall. She loves Techno music. She is scared of the dark. She wants to be reincarnated as a [[Pokémon]]. She says her best feature is her mouth, as it never stops smiling. She was engaged at the time of the show,<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=235|website=Channel 4|title= Kathreya}}</ref> and has subsequently married.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.bangkokpost.com/life/family/12545/big-brother-thai-star|title= Big Brother Thai Star|publisher= Bangkok Post|accessdate= 16 September 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>
On Day 90, Kathreya was the 13th person to be evicted from the house after receiving 4.9% of the public vote to win, and finished in sixth place.<ref name="surprise">{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15662&position=46 |title=Mohamed And Kathreya Are Evicted |publisher=Channel4.com |date=2 September 2008 |accessdate=2008-09-03 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080905210832/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15662 |archivedate=5 September 2008 }}</ref> Kathreya appeared in pantomime at Leicester Square Theatre's Basement theatre in 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://broadwayworld.com/article/SINDERFELLA_With_Bette_Rinse_Plays_Leicester_Square_Theatres_Basement_Theatre_December_330_20090810|title= SINDERFELLA With Bette Rinse|publisher= broadwayworld|accessdate= 20 September 2009}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
===Lisa=== Lisa Appleton (born 23 May 1968) is a tanning sales rep from [[Warrington]], [[Cheshire]].<ref name="lisa">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=250 Lisa] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-05</ref> She is also involved in charity fund-raising. Lisa is a former [[bodybuilding|bodybuilder]], a fitness and health fanatic and has an 18-year-old daughter. She once appeared on ''[[Gladiators (UK TV series)|Gladiators]]'' as a contestant. She believes in [[reincarnation]], life after death, [[clairvoyants]], [[ghosts]], [[spirit guides]], and universal dynamics. On Day 1, along with Mario, Stephanie, and Luke, Lisa was given a secret mission to hide her relationship with fellow housemate Mario; failure to do so would result in automatic nomination.<ref name="day1task">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=520&housemateId=253&position=2 Dear diary] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-05</ref> On Day 4, the housemates discovered her relationship and Mario and Lisa were subsequently nominated for failing the task.<ref name="housemates guess couple">{{cite web|url=http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_news_topic.php?match=ALL&news_topic=99923&page=59|title=BIG BROTHER - Luke Mario Lisa and Steph to face Eviction Forum • Smeggy's Forums • smeggys.co.uk|author=Andy Mc|work=Smeggy's Forum|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090728011346/http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_news_topic.php?match=ALL&news_topic=99923&page=59|archivedate=28 July 2009|df=dmy-all}}</ref> On Day 84 Sara and Lisa played the [[prisoner's dilemma]] and shared £50,000.<ref name="rte.ie">{{cite news| url=http://www.rte.ie/arts/2008/0828/bigbrother.html | work=RTÉ News | title=Lisa and Sara share £50k, face the boot | date=2008-08-28}}</ref><ref name="uk.popsugar.com">{{cite web|url=http://uk.popsugar.com/1895744|title=Big Brother 9: Eviction 11 — Sara And Lisa|author=POPSUGAR Celebrity UK|work=POPSUGAR Celebrity UK}}</ref><ref name="inentertainment.co.uk">[http://www.inentertainment.co.uk/20080827/big-brother-sara-and-lisa-face-public-vote-25000-richer/ Inentertainment.co.uk]</ref>
In February 2009, Lisa received minor local press attention after she and fiancé Mario found a [[Weevil|Pecan Weevil]] in a bowl of [[Kellogg Company|Kellogs']] ''[[Crunchy Nut Cornflakes]]''<ref name="Unusual breakfast bite for BB pair">[http://www.thisischeshire.co.uk/search/4099733.Unusual_breakfast_bite_for_BB_pair/ Unusual breakfast bite for BB pair], ''This is Chester'', 05/02/2009</ref>
In the television documentary in 2016 ''On Benefits: Living the High Life'' it was said that Lisa had separated from Mario and was now living a single life in a one bedroom rented flat.{{citation needed|date=September 2017}}
===Luke=== Luke Christian Thomas Marsden (born 16 July 1987) was a student at the [[University of Salford]]. Luke loves wrestling and has worked in the North West wrestling scene as a ring announcer, manager and referee. He doesn’t smoke, use drugs or swear, and says a typical weekend night out would be wrestling, Pizza Hut, bowling or the cinema. While in the Big Brother house, Luke celebrated his 21st Birthday. In week 1, as the housemates discovered Mario and Lisa's relationship, Luke was up for eviction for failing the wedding task. Luke became the seventh housemate to be evicted on Day 58 with 37% of the public vote.
Since leaving, Luke continued his relationship with fellow housemate Rebecca but have now split up after 18 months together. On 8 January 2010 Luke made his radio broadcasting début on local station [[Bolton FM]], Luke hosted "''The Luke Marsden Show''" an entertainment show in which he interviewed a different celebrity guest each week, Luke ended the show in February 2012. Luke mentioned on his [http://www.lukemarsden.co.uk/ official website] that he intends to run for political office as a Council candidate in his hometown of Wigan, he has yet to announce when he will run and for what party. Luke wrote a weekly TV Column for [[Star (magazine)|Star Magazine]] which ran from Jan 2011-August 2011. He was also a regular contributor to Hywel and Jamie's radio show's on [[97.4 Rock FM]] & [[Key 103]] from 2010-2015. Luke began presenting his own show on Sunday nights on [[97.4 Rock FM]] in September 2012 – 2015 In May 2013, Luke was the runner-up for the [[Sony Radio Academy]]'s inaugural "Golden Headphones Award" narrowly losing to [[BBC Radio 1|Radio One]] presenters Dan and Phil. In June 2015 Luke joined local radio station [[102.4 Wish FM|WishFM]] where he co-hosts a Saturday morning breakfast show. In Feb 2016 he began co-hosting the [https://audioboom.com/channel/LukeandLucyFM Luke and Lucy FM] podcast.
===Mario===
Shaun Astbury (born 9 June 1965), aka Mario Marconi, is a [[civil servant]] from [[Widnes]], [[Cheshire]]<ref>{{cite web|website=Channel4.com|title=Profile 250|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=250}}</ref> and was formerly a tagging officer for the Home Office, and a post office manager in Liverpool. He was christened Shaun but changed his name to Mario to suit his image. He has previously appeared on various reality TV shows including ''[[Brits Behind Bars]]'',<ref name="Brits Behind Bars">{{cite web|title=Brits Behind Bars|url=http://www.bravo.co.uk/bbb/home.html|accessdate=2008-06-17 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080326234241/http://www.bravo.co.uk/bbb/home.html <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2008-03-26}}</ref> ''[[Ant and Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway]]''<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KhS5GVxoGj8|title=Mario from BB9 set up by Ant & Dec in 2006|date=23 June 2008|publisher=|via=YouTube}}</ref> and BBC Two's ''Kitchen Criminals'' (with current wife Lisa).<ref name="Housemates Revealed Telegraph - Mario">{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/celebritynews/2081044/Big-Brother-is-back-housemates-revealed.html|title=Big Brother is back: housemates revealed|first=Anita|last=Singh|publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=2008-06-05|location=London|date=2008-06-05}}</ref>
Mario entered the house on Day 1 with Lisa; they were the first housemates to enter the House this series.<ref name="here we go">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=500&housemateId=250&position=1 Here we go again] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-05</ref> Mario was nominated in Week 1 because he failed his task to hide his relationship with fellow housemate Lisa.<ref name="housemates guess couple"/>
He appeared with the coat of cash on ''[[The Sunday Night Project]]'' and appeared on [[Big Brother's Little Brother]] after the show.
In February 2009, Mario received minor local press attention after he and fiancé Lisa found a [[Weevil|Pecan Weevil]] in a bowl of [[Kellogg Company|Kellogs']] ''[[Crunchy Nut Cornflakes]]''<ref name="Unusual breakfast bite for BB pair"/> In October 2010, Mario and Lisa got married on The Wedding House.
===Maysoon=== Maysoon Shaladi is an [[actor|actress]], [[model (person)|model]] and [[TV presenter]] from [[London]] who lives in [[Hertfordshire]]. Her career has moved from strength to strength following her appearance on Big Brother and now currently a Bollywood film actress and Item girl. During her career she has also been voted most popular [[video vixen]] and has appeared in [[music video]]s for [[Sean Paul]], [[Melanie C]], [[Jay Sean]], [[Ludacris]] and [[Simon Webbe]]. Other credits in her career include being the face of the Lynx commercials in 2008 and she has featured in campaigns for the [[Sony]] [[PlayStation]] and Apple [[iPod]]. She presented a national talent contest called UK Unsigned. Maysoon is fluent in Arabic and said she went into the Big Brother House to try to change model stereotypes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=631|title=Big Brother|work=Channel 4}}</ref>
===Michael=== Michael 'Mikey' Hughes (born 1974) was appointed Head of House on Day 66.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=13525&position=32 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120724032332/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=13525&position=32 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=24 July 2012 |title=All Change |publisher=Channel 4 |date=9 August 2008 |accessdate=2008-08-12 }}</ref> He finished the series in second place with 48.7% of the public vote.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15825&housemateId=259&position=202 |title=Mikey Is Second |publisher=Channel4.com |date=5 September 2008 |accessdate=2008-09-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080913185344/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15825 |archivedate=13 September 2008 }}</ref> Michael's stint in the house was famous for the fact that he entered the game environment with [[blindness]], having lost his sight ten years beforehand.
He has since continued in his role as a producer/presenter with Insight Radio. He ran as an independent in the [[Glasgow North East by-election, 2009|2009 Glasgow North East by-election]] receiving 54 votes.<ref>{{cite news|url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/glasgow_and_west/8356766.stm|title= Glasgow by-election results|publisher= BBC News|date= 13 November 2009|accessdate= 7 December 2009}}</ref>
===Mohamed=== Mohamed 'Mo' Mohamed (born 16 June 1984) is a student in MMCC who now lives in [[London]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Profile 255|website=Channel 4|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=255}}</ref> Mohamed was born in [[Somalia]] and then moved to [[Kenya]], [[Yemen]], [[Eritrea]], [[Ethiopia]] and [[Dubai]] before moving to the UK with his family and 12 brothers and sisters.
Mohamed became Head of House on Week 12 and was guaranteed a place in the final week. On Day 90 Mohamed was the twelfth person to be evicted from the house, finishing seventh with the lowest percentage of the vote to win, 1.8%, in the final week.<ref name="surprise"/>
===Nicole=== Nicole Cammack (born 28 November 1988), entered the house on Day 58 and is a student from [[Surrey]], as well as Rex's girlfriend.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=930|title=Big Brother|work=Channel 4}}</ref> Nicole had previously been in the task room the week before becoming a housemate, as part of the Cops and Robbers shopping task.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=10844&position=39|title= The Usual Suspects|publisher= Channel 4|date= 29 July 2008|accessdate= 2008-08-12 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080805005158/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=10844&position=39 <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2008-08-05}}</ref> She was in a line-up of actors with Mohamed's brother. Lisa and Luke had to identify Rex's girlfriend, however they failed to identify Nicole and instead chose suspect number 6.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bigbrother9/a117369/luke-mortified-for-crucifying-rexs-girl.html|title= Luke mortified for "crucifying" Rex's girl|publisher= DigitalSpy|accessdate= 2008-08-12}}</ref> Nicole entered the house as the last of the 57 special prizes housemates ordered on their weekly shopping list.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=11407&position=36 |title=It's Nicole! |publisher=Channel 4 |date=1 August 2008 |accessdate=2008-08-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080810123247/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=11407&position=36 |archivedate=10 August 2008 }}</ref> On her first night in the house, Nicole crossed the divide and was subsequently punished by Big Brother who withheld her suitcase until the following week, when it was bought by Head of House Rachel at a cost of £20.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bigbrother9/a120193/rachel-buys-suitcases-in-shopping.html|title= Rachel buys suitcases in shopping|publisher= DigitalSpy|accessdate= 2008-08-12}}</ref>
Nicole was the tenth housemate to be evicted on Day 79 with 94.04% of the vote, the highest eviction percentage in Big Brother UK history, and the third highest in the world, behind Aline from Big Brother Brazil 5 and Big Brother Spain 11's Nagore with a joint 95% of votes (to evict).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=14875&position=28 |title=Nicole Is Evicted! |publisher=Channel4.com |date=22 August 2008 |accessdate=2008-08-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080824235402/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=14875 |archivedate=24 August 2008 }}</ref>
===Rachel=== {{main article|Rachel Rice}} Rachel Rice (born 7 March 1984)<ref name="Rice DOB">{{cite web |url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0723525/ |title=Rachel Rice |accessdate=2008-06-07 |publisher=[[IMDB]] |pages= }}</ref> is a trainee teacher from [[Torfaen]] in Wales.<ref name="rachel">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=258 Rachel] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-05</ref> She took part in around 20 television commercials globally - including the Sony Handicam's 'Fairies at the Bottom of the Garden' in 1991 - until she secured her first film role in ''[[Night Train to Venice]]'' with [[Hugh Grant]] in 1992.<ref name="rachel imdb">[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0723525/bio Rachel Rice] ''Internet Movie Database'' Retrieved 2008-06-05</ref> She is a devout [[Roman Catholic|Catholic]]. She owns five cats. Four weeks prior to appearing in the show Rice had been on a placement teaching English and [[drama]] at [[Caerleon Comprehensive School]]. The last colleagues heard of her was when she went sick with a mystery virus.<ref name="rice">{{cite news |first=Irene |last=Barker |title=Bitten by Big Brother bug: Trainee teacher who went off sick turns up on TV |url=http://www.tes.co.uk |publisher=The Times Educational Supplement |accessdate=2008-06-13 }}</ref>
On Day 59 she completed the Alphabet task to become Head of House, making her the only female to hold this title.
Rachel was the 2008 series winner with 51.3% of the public vote.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15828&position=41 |title=Rachel Is The Winner! |publisher=Channel4.com |date=5 September 2008 |accessdate=2008-09-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080914043207/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15828 |archivedate=14 September 2008 }}</ref>
===Rebecca=== Rebecca 'Bex' Shiner (born 22 April 1987) is a [[nursery nurse]] from [[Coventry]], [[West Midlands (county)|West Midlands]].<ref name="rebecca">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=237 Rebecca] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-05</ref> She is fond of many former boy bands, especially the American group [[Hanson (band)|Hanson]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=re9|title=Rebecca Shiner - Big Brother 9 - 2008 Housemate Forum • Smeggy's Forums • smeggys.co.uk|author=Andy Mc|work=Smeggy's Forum|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090728011505/http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=re9|archivedate=28 July 2009|df=dmy-all}}</ref> An ex-pal said Hanson’s bosses threatened to take out a restraining order after she camped outside their hotels and called their rooms. She was also arrested and taken to the police station for 12 hours when found sleeping on a park bench, following V to Disneyland.<ref name="It’s Broken BBrother">[http://www.newsonfire.com/2008/06/08/its-broken-bbrother-restraining-order-alexandra-de-gale/ It’s Broken BBrother] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080609124628/http://www.newsonfire.com/2008/06/08/its-broken-bbrother-restraining-order-alexandra-de-gale/ |date=9 June 2008 }} ''News On Fire'' Retrieved 2008-06-08</ref> Upon entering the house on Day 1, Rebecca screamed and gasped, to the concern of the other housemates.<ref name="sweet16">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=523&housemateId=237&position=1 Sweet sixteen] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-07</ref> Rebecca was the sixth housemate to be evicted on Day 51 with 65.4% of the public vote.<ref name="Goodbye Rebecca">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=10180 ''Channel 4 official site''] Retrieved 2008-06-25</ref> She is now a regular on [[Television X]]'s sex channels.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/news/coventry-news/big-brother-bex-shiners-strife-3060443 |title= Big Brother Bex Shiner's strife over porn job- from her mum |publisher= Coventry Telegraph |date= 19 July 2010 |accessdate= 2010-07-19}}</ref>
=== Rex === Rex Clayton Newmark (born 6 January 1984) is a [[chef]] from Hampstead, London. Rex comes from a family of restaurateurs and is a head chef at a family restaurant. He claims that his proudest moment was winning a culinary challenge in college.<ref name="Smeggys BB Housemates Rex">{{cite news|title=Smeggy's Big Brother 9 Housemates - Rex|url=http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=rx9|publisher=Smeggys.co.uk|date=2008-07-05|accessdate=2008-07-05|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080819163509/http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=rx9|archivedate=19 August 2008|df=dmy-all}}</ref> His 19-year-old girlfriend Nicole Cammack entered the house on Day 58.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_news_topic.php?match=ni9&news_topic=121897&page=1|title=Nicole Cammack - Big Brother 9 - 2008 - Nicole enters through the store room Forum • Smeggy's Forums • smeggys.co.uk|author=Andy Mc|work=Smeggy's Forum|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090728005237/http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_news_topic.php?match=ni9&news_topic=121897&page=1|archivedate=28 July 2009|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He received the most nominations this series being voted a total of 29 times by his fellow housemates. This at the time was the highest number of nominations until Marcus in Big Brother 10 gained 46 nominations. He also was dating other fellow housemate Nicole. Rex finished the series in fourth place with 22.5% of the public vote.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15824&housemateId=254&position=361 |title=Rex Is Evicted |publisher=Channel4.com |date=5 September 2008 |accessdate=2008-09-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080908023500/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15824 |archivedate=8 September 2008 }}</ref>
Rex appeared in [[Big Brother 2009 (UK)]] as part of the tenth anniversary celebrations, he competed against contestant [[Marcus Akin]] in a task set in Rex's edition of the show. On 4 September 2010, Rex took part [[Ultimate Big Brother]] in the "Enjoy the Silence Task", where he had to taunt UBB contestants whilst they completed mini challenges.
===Sara=== Sara Lorraine Folino (born 26 January 1981) is a [[personal assistant]] from [[London]]. She had a rural upbringing in [[Melbourne]], Australia, but was granted the right to move to London in 2003, because of her Scottish grandmother and her English mother. Sara, a self-described [[Angelina Jolie]] lookalike, used to work in a bank, but now works for [[MTV]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemates/profile.jsp?housemateId=630|title=Big Brother|work=Channel 4}}</ref> Sara says she has a twin brother who is five minutes her junior, but she hasn't seen him since her Italian father kicked her out of the family home when she was 15 years old. She said: "I don't really know what he looks like because I've not been home for five and a half years. I don't really see my family because my dad kicked me out of the house so there's a bit of bad blood there. I do like eating [[hamburger|burgers]] and running on the beach, and something I lay in so I don't need to get up."<ref name="Smeggys BB Housemates Sara">{{cite news|title=Smeggy's Big Brother 9 Housemates - Belinda|url=http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=sa9|publisher=Smeggys.co.uk|date=2008-07-05|accessdate=2008-07-05|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080822064354/http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=sa9|archivedate=22 August 2008|df=dmy-all}}</ref> On Day 84 Sara and Lisa played the [[prisoner's dilemma]] and shared £50,000.<ref name="rte.ie"/><ref name="uk.popsugar.com"/><ref name="inentertainment.co.uk"/> Sara finished the series in third place with 30.1% of the public vote.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15826&housemateId=630&position=238 |title=Sara Is Evicted |publisher=Channel4.com |date=5 September 2008 |accessdate=2008-09-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080908023510/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=15826 |archivedate=8 September 2008 }}</ref>
===Stephanie=== Stephanie "Steph" Jo McMichael (born 1989) is a student from [[Calderstones]], [[Liverpool]]. In 2002, Stephanie was disqualified from ''[[Popstars: The Rivals]],'' the show that created [[Girls Aloud]] and [[One True Voice]], for being too young.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/cbbcnews/hi/tv_film/newsid_2276000/2276977.stm | work=BBC News | title=Under-age Rivals reject gets deal from Louis | date=2002-09-23 | accessdate=2010-05-08}}</ref> On Day 1, along with fellow housemates Mario, Lisa, and Luke, Stephanie was given a secret mission to hide the relationship between housemates Mario and Lisa; as part of this task she was required to pretend to be Mario's girlfriend.<ref name="day1task"/> Failure to complete this mission successfully would result in an automatic nomination of not only her, but also Mario, Lisa, and Luke.<ref name="day1task"/> In her role, she was required to marry Mario thinking that it was a genuine wedding; unbeknownst to her, the marriage was not actually real.<ref name="wedding bells">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=661&position=14 Wedding bells] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-07</ref> Stephanie did not get on well with Mario, which resulted in several arguments between the two of them, one of which resulted in Mario calling Stephanie a [[haemorrhoid]]. Stephanie was nominated during Week 1 because the housemates discovered Mario and Lisa's relationship, failing in her task to hide it.<ref name="housemates guess couple"/> She became the first housemate to be evicted on Day 9 with 48% of the public vote.<ref name="stephanie evicted">[http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=2025&position=30 Stephanie is evicted] ''Channel 4 official site'' Retrieved 2008-06-13</ref>
In 2012, Stephanie and her best friend Twinnie auditioned for the [[The X Factor (UK series 9)|ninth series]] of ''[[The X Factor (UK)|The X Factor]]'' as duo Poisonous Twin. They made it as far as judges' houses,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tellymix.co.uk/reality-tv/big-brother/105180-ex-big-brother-housemate-stephanie-mcmichael-auditions-for-the-x-factor-as-poisonous-twin.html|title=Ex Big Brother housemate Stephanie McMichael auditions for The X Factor as Poisonous Twin - Celebrity Big Brother 2016, The X Factor 2015 - Telly Mix|work=Telly Mix}}</ref> but did not make it through to the live shows.
===Stuart=== Stuart Pilkington (born 1983) is a personal trainer turned property developer from [[Cheadle Hulme]], [[Greater Manchester]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bigbrother/displaycontestant.php?contestant_id=41|title=Stuart|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=2008-06-21}}</ref> Stuart entered the Big Brother house on Day 16, as a replacement for Alexandra. He says he doesn't support any political parties, thinks the world would be better off without religion, and would like to see the monarchy disbanded.<ref name="Smeggys BB Housemates Stuart">{{cite news|title=Smeggy's Big Brother 9 Housemates - Stuart|url=http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=su9|publisher=Smeggys.co.uk|date=2008-07-01|accessdate=2008-07-01|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080819163606/http://www.smeggys.co.uk/big_brother_housemate.php?series=15&id_tag=su9|archivedate=19 August 2008|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Stuart was the ninth person to be evicted from the house on Day 72 with 59% of the public vote.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=14424&position=32 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120721154138/http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/news/newsstory.jsp?id=14424&position=32 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=21 July 2012 |title=Stuart Evicted! |publisher=Channel4.com |date=15 August 2008 |accessdate=2008-08-15 }}</ref> In August, 2010, Stuart took part in a task set out by Victor and Michelle in [[Ultimate Big Brother]] to become [[Nadia Almada]]'s slave for the day.
===Sylvia=== Sylvia Barrie (born 31 August 1986) is a student at the [[University of Derby]] who fled to the United Kingdom from [[Sierra Leone]] when she was 11. She prays daily and attends church regularly. Sylvia was the second housemate to be evicted on Day 23 with 90.2% of the vote. Sylvia became the second black ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|Sun]]'' ''[[Page 3]]'' girl in 2012 and her first feature was on 2 April 2012. This caused a lot of stir within the industry, as some ''Sun Page 3'' fans wrote racial remarks on [[Twitter]]. Sylvia Barrie signed an exclusive contract with ''MJ Management'' who kick-started her modelling career.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bigbrother/displaycontestant.php?contestant_id=35|title=Sylvia|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=2008-06-21}}</ref>

page.title: List of The X Factor finalists (Australia season 2)

revision.text:
{{Use Australian English|date=September 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2012}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''The X Factor'' finalists (Australia season 2)}} The [[The X Factor (Australia season 2)|second season]] of ''[[The X Factor (Australian TV series)|The X Factor Australia]]'' was broadcast on the [[Seven Network]].<ref name="premiere">{{cite web|last=B|first=Andrew|url=http://www.throng.com.au/under-hammer/x-factor-premiere-monday-august-30-730pm|title=The X Factor Premiere Monday August 30, 7.30 pm|work=Throng|publisher=Throng Media|date=16 August 2010|accessdate=25 December 2011}}</ref> It premiered on 30 August 2010 and ended on 22 November 2010.<ref name="premiere"/><ref name="end">{{cite web|author=Lowie|title=Altiyan has The X Factor|url=http://www.mediaspy.org/report/2010/11/23/altiyan-has-the-x-factor/|publisher=Mediaspy.org|date=23 November 2010|accessdate=25 December 2011}}</ref> Each category was mentored by one of the show's four judges [[Guy Sebastian]], [[Ronan Keating]], [[Natalie Imbruglia]] and [[Kyle Sandilands]]. Sandilands mentored the Under 25 Boys,<ref name="Super bootcamp 2013">{{cite episode |title=Season 5, Episode 7: Super bootcamp|series=The X Factor Australia |serieslink=The X Factor (Australian TV series) |network=[[Seven Network]] |airdate=11 August 2013}}</ref> Imbruglia had the Under 25 Girls,<ref name="Super bootcamp 2013"/> Keating mentored the Over 25s and Sebastian was given the Groups.<ref name="end"/> [[Altiyan Childs]] was declared the winner, with Keating emerging as the winning mentor.<ref name="end"/>
==Under 25 Boys==
===Chris Doe=== Chris Doe was a contestant from [[Mornington Peninsula]], Victoria, who sang [[Tonic (band)|Tonic]]'s "[[If You Could Only See]]" at his audition.<ref name="chrisbio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935108/1/chris-doe/ |title=Chris Doe – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=[[Yahoo!7]] |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BDAjA7Q?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935108/1/chris-doe/ |archivedate=24 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> One of the reasons Doe turned up to audition for ''The X Factor'' was to try to find his father because Doe and his twin brother Peter never knew their father.<ref name="chrisbio"/> He began performing at the age of 15 with schoolmates in a local band.<ref name="chrisbio"/> Doe cited [[Green Day]], [[Thirty Seconds to Mars]] and [[Nickelback]] as his musical inspirations.<ref name="chrisbio"/>
===Andrew Lawson=== [[File:Andrew Lawson (6240610846).jpg|thumb|right|150px|Andrew Lawson]] Andrew Lawson was a contestant from [[Shire of Noosa|Noosa]], Queensland, who sang [[Frank Sinatra]]'s "[[Fly Me to the Moon]]" at his audition.<ref name="andrewbio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935117/1/andrew-lawson/ |title=Andrew Lawson – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BDymhh9?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935117/1/andrew-lawson/ |archivedate=24 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Before entering ''The X Factor'', Lawson was a student at the [[Queensland Conservatorium of Music]], where he studied a Bachelor of Music, but then decided to defer his course.<ref name="andrewbio"/> Lawson was born in [[Northern Ireland]] but moved to [[New Zealand]] with his family at the age of six, before moving to Noosa in 2005.<ref name="andrewbio"/> He began playing [[guitar]] at the age of seven and writes his own music.<ref name="andrewbio"/> Lawson cited [[Elvis Presley]], [[Frank Sinatra]], [[Dean Martin]], [[Willie Nelson]] and [[John Mayer]] as his musical inspirations.<ref name="andrewbio"/> Lawson placed third in the competition.<ref name="end"/>
===Mitchell Smith=== Mitchell Smith was a contestant from [[Byron Bay, New South Wales]].<ref name="mitchellbio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935097/1/mitchell-smith/ |title=Mitchell Smith – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BEinWar?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935097/1/mitchell-smith/ |archivedate=24 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Before entering ''The X Factor'', Smith worked in a pizza shop on weekends.<ref name="mitchellbio"/> Smith comes from a musical family as his grandfather was a singer in a jazz band in [[Chicago]].<ref name="mitchellbio"/> He cited John Mayer and [[Eminem]] as his musical inspirations.<ref name="mitchellbio"/>
==Under 25 Girls==
===Sally Chatfield=== Sally Chatfield was a contestant from [[Lakes Entrance, Victoria]].<ref name="sallybio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7934919/1/sally-chatfield/ |title=Sally Chatfield – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BB3ZWnH?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7934919/1/sally-chatfield/ |archivedate=24 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Before entering ''The X Factor'', Chatfield was an apprentice hairdresser.<ref name="sallybio"/> She began singing at the age of seven, which helped her cope with the bullying she endured at school.<ref name="sallybio"/> Chatfield cited [[Jonny Craig]] as her musical influence and her family as her inspiration in life.<ref name="sallybio"/> She was the runner-up of the season.<ref name="end"/>
===India-Rose Madderom=== India-Rose Madderom was a contestant from [[Sydney]], New South Wales who sang [[Joss Stone]]'s version of "[[Some Kind of Wonderful (Soul Brothers Six song)|Some Kind of Wonderful]]" at her audition.<ref name="indiabio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/8176074/1/india-rose-madderom/ |title=India-Rose Madderom – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BBeZv71?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/8176074/1/india-rose-madderom/ |archivedate=24 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Before entering ''The X Factor'', Madderom performed covers in pubs and worked as a waitress.<ref name="indiabio"/> She cited [[Beyoncé]] and [[Rihanna]] as her musical inspirations, and her mother as her main inspiration because she had always encouraged Madderom to sing and perform, despite knowing how tough the music industry is.<ref name="indiabio"/>
===Hayley Teal=== Hayley Teal was a contestant from [[Adelaide]], South Australia, who sang [[Alicia Keys]]' version of "[[How Come U Don't Call Me Anymore?|How Come U Don't Call Me]]" at her audition.<ref name="hayleybio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935086/1/hayley-teal/ |title=Hayley Teal – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BCQLC6q?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935086/1/hayley-teal/ |archivedate=24 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Teal began performing at the age of 12.<ref name="hayleybio"/> Before entering ''The X Factor'', she performed in various cover bands over the past few years.<ref name="hayleybio"/> Teal cited [[Keyshia Cole]], [[Eric Benét]], [[Brian McKnight]], [[Whitney Houston]], [[Mariah Carey]], [[Michael Jackson]] and [[Mary J. Blige]] as her musical inspirations.<ref name="hayleybio"/>
==Over 25s==
===Altiyan Childs=== [[File:Altiyan Childs.jpg|thumb|right|150px|[[Altiyan Childs]]]] {{Main|Altiyan Childs}} Altiyan Childs was a contestant from [[Sydney]], New South Wales, whose first audition did not go so well, but the judges saw something in Childs and asked him to return the next day for another chance.<ref name="altiyanbio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935073/1/altiyan-childs/ |title=Altiyan Childs – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BFS68j0?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935073/1/altiyan-childs/ |archivedate=24 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Childs was born in [[Mount Isa]], Queensland but grew up in Sydney.<ref name="altiyanbio"/> Childs formed his first band at the age of 12.<ref name="altiyanbio"/> After enjoying some success with the band [[Masonia]], whose single "Simple" reached number 41 on the [[ARIA Charts|ARIA Singles Chart]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=Masonia&titel=Simple&cat=s|title=Masonia – Simple|work=Australian-charts.com|publisher=Hung Medien|accessdate=25 December 2011}}</ref> Childs decided to retire from music.<ref name="altiyanbio"/> Before entering ''The X Factor'', he worked as a forklift driver.<ref name="altiyanbio"/> Childs' father encouraged him to audition for the show.<ref name="altiyanbio"/> He cited [[Prince (musician)|Prince]] as his musical inspiration.<ref name="altiyanbio"/> Childs was announced the winner of the season on 22 November 2010 and received a recording contract with [[Sony Music Australia]].<ref name="end"/>
===Amanda Grafanakis=== Amanda Grafanakis was a contestant from [[Melbourne]], Victoria, who sang [[Lady Gaga]]'s "[[Bad Romance]]" at her audition.<ref name="amandabio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935035/1/amanda-grafanakis/ |title=Amanda Grafanakis – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BKdSEJH?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935035/1/amanda-grafanakis/ |archivedate=24 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Grafanakis was born in [[Tasmania]] and comes from a [[Greeks|Greek]] background.<ref name="amandabio"/> She began writing songs at the age of eight and started singing lessons at the age of 12.<ref name="amandabio"/> Grafanakis initially turned up to ''The X Factor'' auditions to support a friend, but ended up deciding to have a go herself.<ref name="amandabio"/> She cited [[Michael Jackson]] as her musical inspiration.<ref name="amandabio"/>
===James McNally=== James McNally was a contestant from Melbourne, Victoria.<ref name="jamesbio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935089/1/james-mcnally/ |title=James McNally – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BL5ZqoB?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935089/1/james-mcnally/ |archivedate=25 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Before entering ''The X Factor'', McNally worked as a financial analyst during weekdays and often performed gigs on the weekends.<ref name="jamesbio"/> At the age of 15, he began writing and recording songs.<ref name="jamesbio"/> McNally grew up performing at Newton's High School for the Performing Arts.<ref name="jamesbio"/> He spent time as part of the [[Schools Spectacular]] program and performed at [[NRL Grand Final]]s and the [[2000 Sydney Olympics]].<ref name="jamesbio"/> McNally has also performed with [[Human Nature (band)|Human Nature]] and [[Vanessa Amorosi]].<ref name="jamesbio"/> In 2008, he auditioned for ''[[Australian Idol]]'', but was not coping with his mother's illness and did not progress in the competition.<ref name="jamesbio"/> McNally cited [[Tina Turner]] as his musical inspiration.<ref name="jamesbio"/>
==Groups==
===Kharizma=== Kharizma was a duo from [[Ipswich, Queensland]], which consisted of sisters Sonja and Soria.<ref name="kharizmabio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935066/1/kharizma/ |title=Kharizma – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BN9nEJy?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935066/1/kharizma/ |archivedate=25 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> They were born in [[New Zealand]] but grew up in Ipswich.<ref name="kharizmabio"/> Kharizma cited [[Beyoncé]], [[Keri Hilson]] and [[Mariah Carey]] as their musical influences.<ref name="kharizmabio"/>
===Luke and Joel=== Luke and Joel was a duo from [[Newcastle, New South Wales]], which consisted of brothers Luke and Joel.<ref name="landjbio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7934932/1/luke-and-joel/ |title=Luke and Joel – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BMTi0qV?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7934932/1/luke-and-joel/ |archivedate=25 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> They both grew up backstage at music gigs, with their father working as a roadie for Australian artists [[Marcia Hines]], [[Mondo Rock]] and [[Jon English]].<ref name="landjbio"/> In 2008, Luke and Joel formed a local band called The Ondays.<ref name="landjbio"/> Before entering ''The X Factor'', Luke worked as a physiotherapist and Joel was a youth worker at an outreach program.<ref name="landjbio"/> Luke also put his wedding on hold after making it into the final 12.<ref name="landjbio"/> His fiancé Jessica auditioned for the show but did not make it through to the bootcamp round.<ref name="landjbio"/> Luke and Joel cited 42 and [[The Rolling Stones]] as their musical inspirations.<ref name="landjbio"/>
===Mahogany=== Mahogany was a four-member girl group from [[Southern Sydney]], New South Wales, which consisted of sisters Maureen, Faye, Trina and Helen. They sang [[Boyz II Men]]'s "[[Thank You (Boyz II Men song)|Thank You]]" at their audition.<ref name="mahoganybio">{{cite web|url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935020/1/mahogany/ |title=Mahogany – The X-Factor |work=The X Factor Australia |publisher=Yahoo!7 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64BLwW4BS?url=http://au.tv.yahoo.com/x-factor/performers/article/-/7935020/1/mahogany/ |archivedate=25 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> In early 2010, Mahogany served as back up singers for one of [[Guy Sebastian]]'s concerts.<ref name="mahoganybio"/> Before entering ''The X Factor'', Maureen and Faye were primary school teachers, Helen worked in retail and Trina was a case manager at [[NRMA]].<ref name="mahoganybio"/> Mahogany cited [[Destiny's Child]] and [[The Jackson 5]] as their musical influences, and [[Michael Jackson]] as their musical inspiration.<ref name="mahoganybio"/>

In [[Cook Islands mythology]] (Aitutaki), '''Nganaoa''' is a hero in the story of Rata's canoe who killed three sea-monsters: a gigantic [[clam]], a huge [[octopus]], a finally a great [[whale]] in the stomach of which he found his father, [[Tairitokerau]], and his mother Vāiaroa alive (Gill 1876:147).
==References== *W.W. Gill, ''Myths and Songs of the South Pacific'' (Henry S. King: London), 1876.

[[Ss. Cyril and Methodius University of Skopje|University of Skopje]] }} '''Nikola Gruevski''' ({{lang-mk|Никола Груевски}} {{IPA-mk|ˈnikɔɫa ˈɡruefski||Mk-Nikola Gruevski.ogg}}; {{lang-hu|Nikola Gruevszki}}; born 31 August 1970) is a [[Republic of Macedonia|Macedonian]] politician. He served as [[Prime Minister of Macedonia]] from 27 August 2006 to 18 January 2016, and led the [[VMRO-DPMNE]] party from May 2003 until December 2017. He was Minister of Finance in the VMRO-DPMNE government led by [[Ljubčo Georgievski]] until September 2002. Under the [[Pržino Agreement]] mediated by the [[European Union]], Gruevski agreed to resign and left his post on 18 January 2016.http://www.balkanews.org/index.php/2016/01/27/macedonia-premier-to-step-down-under-western-brokered-deal/ {{Dead link|date=September 2016}} In May 2018, he was sentenced to two years in prison on corruption charges. In November 2018, he was ordered to serve his prison sentence but failed to check in with authorities, and instead [[fugitive|fled]] to Hungary where he sought and was granted [[political asylum]]. == Personal life == Born in [[Skopje]] in 1970, Gruevski was brought up in a family that was neither privileged nor poor. His father worked in furniture and design and his mother was a nurse. After his parents’ divorce, he was raised by his mother. At the age of four, however, she went to work in [[Libya]], like thousands of other Yugoslav citizens, and took him with her.[https://www.economist.com/blogs/easternapproaches/2011/08/macedonias-prime-minister A profile of Gruevski], The Economist, 12 August 2011 After their return Gruevski completed primary and secondary education in [[Skopje]]. Having graduated from the Faculty of Economics at [[St. Clement of Ohrid University of Bitola]] in 1994 (where he dabbled in amateur theatre and boxing) he entered the nascent finance sector, and was the first person to trade on Skopje's stock exchange. During 1995 he worked as director of department in [[Multigroup]] owned Balkanbank, and became its exhibitioner till 1998. In 1996 he also acquired qualifications for the international capital market from a London Securities Institute.{{cite web |author=iBi Center |url=http://www.nato-pa.int/Default.asp?SHORTCUT=1136 |title=NATO PA – PLENARY – Nikola Gruevski |publisher=Nato-pa.int |accessdate=14 August 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722013525/http://www.nato-pa.int/Default.asp?SHORTCUT=1136 |archivedate=22 July 2011 |df=dmy-all }} Gruevski founded the Brokerage Association of Macedonia in 1998 and made the first transaction on the [[Macedonian Stock Exchange]].{{cite web|url=http://www.vlada.mk/?q=node/958 |title=President of the Government of the Republic of Macedonia | Влада На Република Македонија |publisher=Vlada.mk |accessdate=14 August 2010}} On 12 December 2006, he obtained a master's degree from the Faculty of Economics at Ss. Cyril and Methodius University of Skopje.{{cite web|url=http://www.ukim.edu.mk/en_index.php |title=уким |publisher=Ukim.edu.mk |date=17 December 2008 |accessdate=14 August 2010}} Gruevski divorced his first wife and married again in May 2007 to Borkica Gruevska with whom he has two daughters: Anastasija and Sofija.{{cite web|url=http://www.vest.com.mk/?ItemID=283177ACA95DDA4AB2C30BBBE230C259|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090819111509/http://www.vest.com.mk/?ItemID=283177ACA95DDA4AB2C30BBBE230C259|dead-url=yes|archive-date=19 August 2009|title=Vest|publisher=|accessdate=14 May 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://daily.mk/html/makedonija_12165_704_0|title=Daily.mk - Вести|website=Daily.MK - Вести|accessdate=14 May 2017}} Gruevski's paternal grandparents stem from the [[Monastir Vilayet|Ottoman Macedonia]] village of [[Achlada|Krushoradi]], where his grandfather Nikola Grouios (1911–1940) was born. Until the official Greek annexation after the [[Second Balkan War]] in 1913, it was under the jurisdiction of the [[Bulgarian Exarchate]].{{cite web|url=http://anemi.lib.uoc.gr/php/pdf_pager.php?filename=/var/www/tkl-portal-neo//metadata/6/9/5/attached-metadata-5d3c137498cf87397083652dec9dfdac_1242889374/154547_w.pdf&lang=en&pageno=1&pagestart=1&width=1031&height=728&maxpage=141|title=PDF pager|website=anemi.lib.uoc.gr|accessdate=14 May 2017}} The Greek administration later led assimilative anti-Bulgarian campaign, changing the names of the local villagers to the corresponding Greek names.Collective Memory, National Identity, and Ethnic Conflict: Greece, Bulgaria, and the Macedonian Question, Author Victor Roudometof, Greenwood Publishing Group, 2002, {{ISBN|0275976483}}, pp. 62-63.Ivo Banac, [http://promacedonia.org/en/ib/i_banac.html "The Macedoine"] in "The National Question in Yugoslavia. Origins, History, Politics", pp. 307-328, Cornell University Press, 1984, retrieved on 8 September 2007. ''Macedonia was partitioned by the Treaty of Bucharest (1913), whereby over half of the land went to Greece (Aegean Macedonia) and most of the remainder to Serbia (Vardar Macedonia), leaving slightly more than one-tenth to Bulgaria (Pirin Macedonia)...The immediate effect of the partition was the anti-Bulgar campaign in areas under Serbian and Greek rule. The Serbians expelled Exarchist churchmen and teachers and closed Bulgar schools and churches (affecting the standing of as many as 641 schools and 761 churches). Thousands of Macedonians left for Bulgaria, joining a still larger stream from devastated Aegean Macedonia, where the Greeks burned Kukush, the center of Bulgar politics and culture, as well as much of Serres and Drama. Bulgarian (including the Macedonian dialects) was prohibited, and its surreptitious use, whenever detected, was ridiculed or punished. ''''For a detailed report on the atrocities of Greek Boulgarophagoi (Bulgarianeaters) in Aegean Macedonia, see [[Report of the International Commission on the Balkan Wars]].''. The village itself was renamed by the Greek authorities to [[Achlada]] in 1926.{{cite web|url=http://pandektis.ekt.gr/pandektis/handle/10442/169123|title=Πανδέκτης: Krousorati -- Achlada|website=pandektis.ekt.gr|accessdate=14 May 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.dnevnik.com.mk/default-mk.asp?ItemID=E02741FE0CDEF14487FFB7338443B82A&arc=1 |title=Dnevnik |publisher=Dnevnik |date=22 February 1999 |accessdate=14 August 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101004182810/http://www.dnevnik.com.mk/default-mk.asp?ItemID=E02741FE0CDEF14487FFB7338443B82A&arc=1 |archivedate=4 October 2010 |df=dmy-all }} Gruevski's grandfather fought in the [[Greco-Italian War]], where he lost his life. His name is mentioned on the [[war memorial]] in Achlada among the names of the locals who were killed during [[World War II]]. Years later, during the [[Greek Civil War]], Gruevski's grandmother and father fled north to what was then [[Socialist Republic of Macedonia|Yugoslav Macedonia]], where they changed their family name to Gruevski in order to gain citizenship through assimilation, as was the Yugoslav policy at the time.{{cite web|url=http://balkanwitness.glypx.com/shoup.pdf,|title=Yugoslavias National Minorities Under Communism|publisher=|accessdate=14 May 2017}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=Thryduulf |fix-attempted=yes }} Gruevski's maternal grandfather - Mihail D. Miyalkov was a pro-Bulgarian activist and a member of Bulgarian club founded in Stip in November 1942, when the area was annexed by Bulgaria.Общограждански национален клуб "Благой Монев" - "Протокол и устав на Щипския общограждански национален клуб "Благой Монев", Щип, 1942 година. His mother Nadezhda is also from Stip. She is the sister of the first Minister of the Interior of the Republic of Macedonia - [[Jordan Mijalkov]]. During the administration of Nikola Gruevski, his first cousin, [[Sašo Mijalkov]] was the director of the [[Administration for Security and Counterintelligence]] of the Republic of Macedonia. == Political career, 1999–present == === Minister of Finance (1999–2002) === The government under [[Ljubčo Georgievski]] sold the [[Makedonski Telekom|Macedonian Telecom]] to Hungarian [[Magyar Telekom|Matáv]] and the [[OKTA]] oil refinery to [[Hellenic Petroleum]]. Gruevski also implemented financial reforms, including the reform of the payment system and the [[value added tax]] of 18%, requiring fiscal receipts for all Macedonian businesses, which was a program designed to fight [[Tax avoidance and tax evasion|tax evasion]]. === Party leader (2003–2017) === Gruevski is the leader of the nationalist ruling party [[VMRO-DPMNE]]. After VMRO-DPMNE was defeated in the [[Macedonian parliamentary election, 2002|2002 parliamentary election]], there was a period of infighting within the party. Gruevski emerged as the pro-EU leader, and he was elected as leader of the party after Ljubčo Georgievski left the position. The former prime minister set up his own party ([[VMRO-NP|VMRO-People's Party]]), but VMRO-DPMNE retained most of the party's supporters. ==== Prime Minister (2006–2016) ==== {{See also|List of state visits made by Nikola Gruevski}} [[File:Secretary Clinton Poses for a Photo With Macedonian Prime Minister Gruevski (5451270905).jpg|thumb|Gruevski and U.S. Secretary of State [[Hillary Clinton]], Washington, D.C., 16 February 2011]] The VMRO-DPMNE won the [[Macedonian parliamentary election, 2006|July 2006 parliamentary election]], and on 25 August 2006 he constituted the new government. His government had many new faces, mostly in their 30s, in key ministries and other positions. In the election Gruevski earned the distinction of becoming the first elected European head of government born in the 1970s.[http://www.economist.com/node/13768417 Who's your daddy?] (accessed 24 December 2010)[http://www.mes.gov.me/en/depprminister/biography Deputy Prime Minister > Biography] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722174742/http://www.mes.gov.me/en/depprminister/biography |date=22 July 2011}} (accessed 24 December 2010) In June 2007, Gruevski attended a meeting in [[Tirana]], Albania, along with [[List of Presidents of the United States|President of the United States]] [[George W. Bush]], [[List of Prime Ministers of Albania|Prime Minister of Albania]] [[Sali Berisha]], and [[List of Prime Ministers of Croatia|Prime Minister of Croatia]] [[Ivo Sanader]].http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/PPP-2007-book1/pdf/PPP-2007-book1-doc-pg726.pdf The coalition led by his party, VMRO-DPMNE, won the [[Macedonian parliamentary election, 2008|1 June 2008 parliamentary election]], their second electoral victory in a row, winning more than half of the seats in the parliament.{{cite web|url=http://www.parties-and-elections.de/macedonia.html|title=Macedonia|last=|first=|date=|website=Parties and Elections in Europe|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081204003818/http://www.parties-and-elections.de/macedonia.html|archive-date=4 December 2008|dead-url=yes|accessdate=14 May 2017|df=dmy-all}} The polling was marred by a number of violent incidents and allegations of fraud in some ethnic Albanian dominated municipalities. Gruevski created a government with the ethnic Albanian political party [[Democratic Union for Integration]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7430468.stm "PM claims win in Macedonian poll"], BBC News, Link accessed 01/06/08 [[File:EPP Brussels Summit; Mar. 2014 (13288819644).jpg|thumb|left|[[European People's Party]] Summit in [[Brussels]] in March 2014]] The coalition led by his party, VMRO-DPMNE, won the [[Macedonian parliamentary election, 2011|5 June 2011 parliamentary election]], their third electoral victory in a row, winning 56 out of the 123 seats in the parliament. Objections of misuse of state resources, including the blackmail of over one hundred thousand public servants to act as agitators were neglected, and the elections were declared valid. Gruevski formed the new government, again in coalition with the Democratic Union for Integration. On 6 January 2012, Gruevski opened the [[triumphal arch]] "[[Porta Macedonia]]" in [[Skopje]] as a monument to 20th anniversary of Macedonian independence, and admitted that he personally has been the instigator of the [[Skopje 2014]] project.{{cite web|url=https://globalvoices.org/2012/03/28/macedonia-kazakhstan-triumphal-arches-to-celebrate-20-years-of-independence/|title=Macedonia, Kazakhstan: Triumphal Arches to Celebrate 20 Years of Independence · Global Voices|date=28 March 2012|publisher=|accessdate=14 May 2017}}{{cite news|url=http://macedoniaonline.eu/content/view/20045/45/|title=PM Gruevski: Yes, Skopje 2014 was my Idea|date=7 January 2012|publisher=MINA|accessdate=30 July 2012}} On 27 April 2014, VMRO-DPMNE won the [[Macedonian parliamentary election, 2014|parliamentary election]], providing Gruevski another term as Prime Minister. ==== Wiretapping scandal and resignation==== In May 2015, protests occurred in [[Skopje]] against the Gruevski and his government. Protests began following charges being brought up against [[Zoran Zaev]], the opposition leader, who responded by alleging that Gruevski had 20,000 Macedonian officials and other figures wiretapped, and covered up the murder of a young man by a police officer in 2011. A major [[2015 Macedonian protests|protest]] occurred on 5 May, seeing violent clashes between activists and police, with injuries on both sides. In the days afterward, the opposition claimed that more anti-government actions will occur, which they did later that month. Several ministers, including the interior minister, resigned during the protests. Gruevski initially refused to step down, saying on 16 May that "if I back down it would be a cowardly move ... I’ll face down the attacks.” However on 15 January 2016, [[Emil Dimitriev]] was nominated as [[Prime Minister of the Republic of Macedonia|prime minister]] of Macedonia and he assumed office on 18 January, following the arranged pre-electoral resignation of Gruevski from the position, as part of the [[Przino Agreement]]. ====After departure from office==== In July 2017, a Macedonian court ordered the seizure of the passports of Gruevski and four other officials of his party, including former interior minister [[Gordana Jankuloska]] and former transportation minister [[Mile Janakieski]], in connection with the wiretapping case.{{cite web|url=https://www.rferl.org/a/macedonian-court-orders-seizure-conservative-leaders-passports-gruevski-illegal-wiretapping-case/28594795.html/|title=Macedonian Court Orders Seizure of Conservative Leaders' Passports in Wiretapping Case|publisher=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty|date=July 4, 2017}} In December 2017, Gruevski resigned as leader of the VMRO-DPMNE,[https://www.reuters.com/article/us-macedonia-politics/former-macedonian-rightist-pm-resigns-party-leadership-idUSKBN1E515J Former Macedonian rightist PM resigns party leadership], Reuters (December 11, 2017). following the party's major defeat by the Social Democratic Union in [[Macedonian local elections, 2017|local elections]].[https://www.rferl.org/a/macedonia-vmro-dpmne-guevski-plans-to-step-down-party-leader/28891652.html Macedonia's Gruevski Says He Will 'Soon' Step Down As Leader Of VMRO-DPMNE], Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty (December 2, 2017). ==== Trial ==== In January 2017, the Macedonian Special Prosecutor's Office launched the 'Tank' investigation in which two individuals were accused for using their official position and authority in the period from February to October 2012 to complete an illegal public procurement of a [[Mercedes-Benz 600]] worth €600,000 and 'fulfill the wishes' of Gruevski who was Prime Minister at the time."[http://meta.mk/en/spo-launches-new-tank-case-for-gruevski-s-600-000-euro-mercedes/ SPO launches new “Tank” case for Gruevski’s 600,000 euro “Mercedes”]". ''Meta.mk''. 24 January 2017. On 23 May 2018, Gruevski was sentenced to two years in prison for unlawfully influencing government officials in a purchase of a luxury bulletproof car."[https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/macedonian-court-sentences-former-pm-gruevski-to-2-years/2018/05/23/dad0daa6-5e80-11e8-b656-236c6214ef01_story.html Macedonian court sentences former PM Gruevski to 2 years]". ''[[The Washington Post]]''. 23 May 2018."[https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/macedonian-court-sentences-pm-gruevski-years-55376497 Macedonian court sentences former PM Gruevski to 2 years]". ''[[ABC News]]''. 23 May 2018.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2018/05/23/world/europe/ap-eu-macedonia-pm-sentenced.html|title=Macedonian Court Sentences Former PM Gruevski to 2 Years |publisher=New York Times |accessdate=23 May 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://balkaneu.com/gruevski-sentenced-to-2-years-in-prison-in-tank-case/|title=Gruevski sentenced to 2 years in prison in 'Tank' case |publisher=BalkanEU.com |accessdate=23 May 2018}} In 9 November 2018, the Skopje Criminal Court rejected Gruevski's appeals for a postponement of his prison sentence and he failed to show up to start serving his two-year jail sentence. The Macedonian authorities issued an arrest warrant against the [[fugitive]] and a country-wide search was launched. VMRO-DPMNE's leader, [[Hristijan Mickoski]] defended Gruevski and described the arrest-warrant and police search against him as "political persecution" and "[[witch-hunt]]" and that VMRO-DPMNE is "under police siege".{{cite web|url=http://www.balkaninsight.com/en/article/macedonia-puzzled-about-gruevski-s-whereabouts-11-13-2018|title=Macedonia Police Intensify Hunt for Ex-PM Gruevski|website=balkaninsight.com|date=13 November 2018| accessdate=13 November 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://english.republika.mk/nikola-gruevski-is-victim-of-political-persecution-and-witch-hunt-that-the-international-and-criminal-authorities-are-leading-against-him/|title=Nikola Gruevski is victim of political persecution and witch-hunt that the international and criminal authoirities are leading against him|website=republika.mk|date=12 November 2018| accessdate=13 November 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://english.republika.mk/gruevski-is-victim-of-a-witch-hunt-meant-to-distract-the-public-from-government-failures/|title=Gruevski is victim of a witch-hunt meant to distract the public from Government failures|website=republika.mk|date=12 November 2018| accessdate=13 November 2018}} ==== Exile ==== [[File:EPP Summit 2015-06 Orbán 3.jpg|thumb|right|Gruevski and [[Viktor Orbán]] in June 2015]] On 13 November, Gruevski announced through his [[Facebook]] account that he fled to [[Hungary]], where he applied for [[political asylum]].{{cite web|url=http://english.republika.mk/gruevski-im-seeking-asylum-in-hungary-after-receiving-numerous-death-threats/|title=Gruevski: I'm seeking asylum in Hungary after receiving numerous death threats|website=republika.mk|date=13 November 2018| accessdate=13 November 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.balkaninsight.com/en/article/macedonia-s-fugitive-ex-pm-seeking-asylum-in-hungary--11-13-2018|title=Fugitive Macedonian Ex-PM 'Seeking Asylum in Hungary'|website=Balkan Insight|date=13 November 2018| accessdate=13 November 2018}} Gruevski was seen as having particularly close relations with the right-wing [[national conservatism|national conservative]] [[Fidesz]]'s head, and Prime Minister of Hungary, [[Viktor Orbán]], who opposed the [[Prespa agreement]] between Greece and Macedonia and supported VMRO-DPMNE's hardline position against it.Aleksandar Ivković, Orbán opposes Greece-Macedonia agreement, supports VMRO-DPMNE protests. [https://europeanwesternbalkans.com/2018/06/05/orban-opposes-greece-macedonia-agreement-supports-vmro-dpmne-protests/ European Western Balkans, 05.06.2018.] Despite his passport having been confiscated, Gruevski has successfully escaped and concerns arose, that he probably used a Bulgarian one.VIP-eljárást kap Gruevszki a kormánytól. [https://nepszava.hu/3015212_vip-eljarast-kap-gruevszki-a-kormanytol Népszava Címlap, 2018.11.14.] However, according to Bulgarian authorities, Gruevski has never applied for Bulgarian citizenship.Bulgarian Ministry of Justice: Nikola Gruevski has not become a Bulgarian citizen. [http://www.focus-fen.net/news/2018/11/15/435767/bulgarian-ministry-of-justice-nikola-gruevski-has-not-become-a-bulgarian-citizen.html FOCUS News Agency, 15 November 2018]. It was later confirmed by the Albanian police that, with the aid of the [[Hungarian government]] which escorted him using Hungarian diplomatic vehicles, Gruevski entered Albania, and from there into Montenegro and Serbia before arriving at Hungary where he sought asylum.{{cite web|url=http://www.balkaninsight.com/en/article/macedonia-s-gruevski-fled-via-albania-and-montenegro-police-confirm-11-15-2018|title=Macedonia’s Gruevski Fled via Albania and Montenegro, Police Confirm |website=Balkan Insight|date=15 November 2018| accessdate=16 November 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.b92.net/eng/news/region.php?yyyy=2018&mm=11&dd=15&nav_id=105525|title=Police: Gruevski fled to Hungary via Albania and Montenegro |website=b92.net|date=15 November 2018| accessdate=16 November 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://toronto.citynews.ca/2018/11/16/fugitive-macedonian-ex-pm-passed-through-montenegro/|title=Fugitive Macedonian ex-PM 'passed through' Montenegro|website=toronto.citynews.ca|date=16 November 2018| accessdate=16 November 2018}} [[Interpol]] alerted that Gruevski is wanted under an [[international arrest warrant]] and the Macedonian government filed a formal extradition request. Hungary's opposition parties are calling on the Hungarian government to arrest and quickly extradite the fugitive former Macedonian PM, back to the Republic of Macedonia.{{cite web|url=http://www.wsfa.com/2018/11/14/latest-macedonia-ex-leader-requests-asylum-hungary/|title=Hungary opposition wants Gruevski extradition|website=wsfa.com|date=14 November 2018| accessdate=15 November 2018}} On 20 November 2018, Nikola Gruevski was granted political asylum by the Hungarian authorities.{{cite web|url=http://www.balkaninsight.com/en/article/macedonia-s-gruevski-accuses-of-assassination-plot-11-20-2018|title=Macedonia’s Gruevski Gets Hungary Asylum, Alleges Murder Plot|website=Balkaninsight|date=20 November 2018| accessdate=20 November 2018}} ==Awards and recognition== ===Recognitions === * 2014: Order St. Nicholas – Highest Award of [[Štip]]{{cite web|url=http://meta.mk/en/gruevski-dobitnik-na-najvisokoto-priznanie-na-shtip-sveti-nikola/?show_desktop_mode=true|title=Gruevski receives highest award of Shtip, "St. Nicholas" - Meta.mk|website=meta.mk|accessdate=14 May 2017}} * 2015: Order Baptist (Preteca) from [[Saint Jovan Bigorski Monastery]]{{cite web|url=http://www.bigorski.org.mk/index.php?content_type=sluzhbi_bdenija&action=details&record_id=1738|title=† Бигорски манастир - Свети Јован Крстител †|website=† Бигорски манастир}} ===Awards === * Vienna Economic Forum award – for contribution to national and regional economic development (2011){{cite web|url=http://vlada.mk/node/762?language=en-gb|title=PM Gruevski recipient of Vienna Economic Forum award|website=Влада на Република Македонија|accessdate=14 May 2017}} == References == {{reflist}} == Further reading == * Gruevski, Nikola and [[Sam Vaknin|Vaknin, Sam]] ''Macedonian Economy on a Crossroads'', Skopje, NIP Noval Literatura, 1998. {{ISBN|9989-610-01-0}} * Gruevski, Nikola, [https://web.archive.org/web/20090818143833/http://www.globalpolitician.com/23730-macedonia ''The Way Out''] == External links == {{commons category|Nikola Gruevski}} * [http://www.vlada.mk/?q=node/958 Biography of Gruevski at the Homepage of the Government of the Republic of Macedonia] * [http://worldcat.org/oclc/52239639&referer=brief_results Book: Makedonskata ekonomija na krstopat : na patot kon pozdrava ekonomija by Nikola Gruevski and Sam Vaknin] {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before={{ill|Boris Stojmenov|mk|Борис Стојменов|ru|Стойменов, Борис}}}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Ministry of Finance (Republic of Macedonia)|Minister of Finance]]|years=1999–2002}} {{s-aft|after=[[Petar Gosev]]}} |- {{s-bef|before=[[Vlado Bučkovski]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Prime Minister of Macedonia]]|years=2006–2016}} {{s-aft|after=[[Emil Dimitriev]]}} {{s-end}} {{MacedonianPMs}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gruevski, Nikola}} [[Category:1970 births]] [[Category:Internal Macedonian Revolutionary Organization – Democratic Party for Macedonian National Unity politicians]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Macedonian criminals]] [[Category:Macedonian nationalists]] [[Category:People from Skopje]] [[Category:Prime Ministers of the Republic of Macedonia]] [[Category:Ss.
